intro: Tanacetum germanicopolitanum, commonly known as the Germanicopolitanum tansy, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
